text: Nikita Ivanovich Naidenov (, 6 April 1892 – 19 September 1961) was a Russian speed skater. In 1913 he won the national allround title and bronze medals at the European and world allround speed skating championships. Naidenov was also an accomplished pilot and fought in World War I. In June 1925, together with a group of several other Russian pilots, he flew 6476 km on Junkers F.13 from Moscow to Beijing. ==References== Category:1892 births Category:1961 deaths Category:Russian male speed skaters Category:World Allround Speed Skating Championships medalists
title: Nikita Naidenov
